Is it safe to send 404 for unavailable representations of an existing resource?

Let's suppose the resource is /foo

GET /foo
<= 200 OK

GET /foo.xml
<= 404 Not Found

GET /foo
Accept: application/xml

<= 404 Not Found

Is the right thing to do?

It sounds a bit odd because the resource is actually there, but not
with the representation the client wants, so I
thought maybe there's a proper way to do so.
